718716f-a.text:
Nos. 217-219 Cherry Street, adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of Pike Slip. Note clearance directly on corner proper. The view shous the suspended road bed of the Manhattan Bridge. The towers of the cable support of the Brooklyn Bridge appears over the roof tops.
June 17, 1936.
P. I  . Sperr.

718719f-a.text:
Cherry Street, west from Pike Slip (under the Manhattan Bridge anchorage), showing a slum clearance project, Knickerbocker Village
lyihg between Market and Catherine Streets.
1939
Alexander Alland
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of N. Y." by Folix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.

718721f-a.text:
217, 219 and 2192-221 Cherry Street, adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of Pike Slip. The clearance shown on the extreme right was the
site of No. 71 Pike Slip, the corner building.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

722570f-a.title: Manhattan: Pike Slip - Cherry Street
722570f-a.text:
73 to 77 Pike Slip, east side, south from Cherry to Water Streets. The clearance at the S.E. corner of Pike Slip and Cherry Street was formerly the site of No. 71. Also shown are Nos. 217, 219 and 2192-22 Cherry Street,
adjoining and east of the S.E. corner of Pike Slip.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
